gale:repo.gale:text: research projects that have had a great impact on the development of [[../aha|AHA!]] and [[../gale|GALE]]

Several research projects have had a great impact on the development of [[../aha|AHA!]] and [[../gale|GALE]]. The [[=http://nlnet.nl|NLnet]] funded [[=http://nlnet.nl/project/aha/description.html|AHA! project]] resulted in a standalone generic adaptation engine. The [[../aha/concept-editor|concept editor]] and [[../aha/graph-author|Graph Author]] tools were developed to improve the authoring of adaptive applications. In the [[=http://www.prolearn-project.org/|ProLearn]] Network of Excellence, interaction with other systems became a vital part. One of the developments related to AHA! was a 'MOT/LAG to AHA! compiler' [[../references?tags=Cris05|[Cris05~]]].
The [[als|Adaptive Learning Spaces project]] (ALS) focussed on integrating tools for collaboration and adaptivity in an existing Learning Management System (LMS). It exposed some of the flaws in AHA!'s design that prevented it from being easily integrated in such an environment. AHA!'s architecture was changed so fundamentally, and the [[grapple|GRAPPLE project]] would require even more changes, that the result was released under a new name: [[../gale|GALE]].
